The cart view displays selected items with a total price, allowing users to proceed to checkout.","new_testing_goal":"Select the 'Galaxy A30' smartphone model, add it to the cart, proceed to checkout, and complete the purchase process for this specific model.","explanation":"Click on the 'add to cart' button for the 'Galaxy A30' smartphone model. messages.content: Given a web application, you are tasked with assisting in testing its functionality. The emulate_interaction function takes an interaction as input and emulates it on the web application. The return value of the function is the new, filtered HTML source code of the web application. The source code of previous interactions will be omitted from the input to the assistant.
Here are some examples how the 'emulate_interaction' function should be used.
Please test my website: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description": "The start page of a web site with multiple calculators for different purposes. There are buttons to navigate to the differet calculators and a button to switch the language of the web site. The current language is English.", "new_testing_goal": "Test the calculator for calculating the area of a circle in multiple languages.", "explanation": "First navigate to the calculator for the area of a circle. Then input a radius and calculate the area. Switch the language of the web site and repeat the process.", "interaction": {"interaction_type": "click", "element_id": "btn-area-circle"}}

The user provided the following end instructions: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases.
Pursue your self-assigned sub-goal or assign a new one: Select the 'Galaxy M10' smartphone model, add it to the cart, proceed to checkout, and complete the purchase process for this specific model..

Previously executed interactions by goal: {"Add the 'Galaxy S10 5G' to the cart and proceed to checkout.": 1, "Clear the cart and add the 'Galaxy S10 5G' to the cart again, then proceed to checkout.": 1, "Test the checkout process by adding the 'Galaxy S10+' to the cart, proceeding to checkout, and simulating a successful order placement.": 1, "Proceed to checkout with the 'Galaxy S10+' in the cart and simulate the payment process.": 1, "Fill in the customer information, address details, choose a payment method, and submit the checkout form.": 1, "Choose a payment method, submit the checkout form, and verify the successful completion of the transaction process.": 1, "Simulate selecting different payment methods and verifying the successful completion of the transaction process for each method.": 1, "Simulate selecting different payment methods and verify the successful completion of the transaction process for each method.": 1, "Simulate selecting each payment method, verifying the completion of the transaction process for each one, and checking for potential bugs or issues.": 3, "Simulate selecting each Samsung smartphone model, adding it to the cart, and proceeding to checkout to test the complete purchase process for each model.": 1, "Select the 'Galaxy A80' smartphone model, add it to the cart, proceed to checkout, and complete the purchase process.": 1, "Select the 'Galaxy A80' smartphone model, add it to the cart, proceed to checkout, and complete the purchase process for this specific model.": 1, "Select the 'Galaxy M10' smartphone model, add it to the cart, proceed to checkout, and complete the purchase process for this specific model.": 1}.

Start by describing the website supplied by the function call. Give a short general description first then summarize the main elements on the website. Do not use HTML in your description. Then you may formulate a high level sub-goal to the user's instructions, that should be persued with the next couple of interactions. You should formulate a new sub-goal if the current one has been completed or seems to be unattainable. Give an action plan that explains how the goal should be reached. And finally, describe the interaction to emulate.

Only use the click action with clickable elements. The clickable elements have the following ids: :r19:, :r0:-home, :r0:-galaxy, :r0:-s10, :r0:-m_series, :r0:-a_series, :r1:, :r2:, :r1a:, :r1b:, :r1c:, :r1d:, :r1e:, :r1f:. Only use the send_keys action with writable elements. The writable elements have the following ids: :r1g:, :r1h:, :r1i:, :r1j:, :r1k:, :r1l:, :r1m:, :r1n:.

functions.name: emulate_interaction
functions.description: Emulates a user interaction with the web application

page_description.description: A short textual description of the state of the web application: What is the current page? What are the main elements on the page? This description should not contain any HTML.

new_testing_goal.description: Assigns a new high level sub-goal that shall be followed in order to complete the users instructions. This goal should take multiple user interactions to complete. The assistant shall try to complete this goal in the next couple of interactions and then assign a new one.

explanation.description: An action plan that explains how the goal should be reached.

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

keys.description: the keys to be sent to the input element

anyOf.description: sends keystrokes to an html element
